str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
A cloud. From nephos; properly, cloudiness, i.e. a cloud.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A cloud. From nephos; properly, cloudiness, i.e. a cloud.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Golden, made of gold, adorned with gold. From chrusos; made of gold.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
(a) sharp, (b) swift, eager. Probably akin to the base of akmen; keen; by analogy, rapid.
A sickle, pruning-hook. From drepo; a gathering hook.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A hand.
